alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Letcher (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Harlan, southwestern Letcher and southern Perry Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hiram, or 15 miles southwest of Whitesburg, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Linefork around 550 PM EDT. Hiram and Diane around 555 PM EDT. Cumberland and Kingdom Come S.P. around 600 PM EDT. Blair around 605 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Clutts, Benham, Black Bottom, Louellen, Lewis Creek, Lynch, Closplint, Lejunior and Clover-Darby. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
